property.name: Text
property.value: Starting with the Winner and going clockwise, one of your opponent's Dudes can start a job to rob the stage in the Town Square. You can form a posse to defend it if you wish. If the job succeeds, pay that player 4 ghost rock, or your total ghost rock if you have less than 4. If nobody attacks the stage or the job fails, you gain 4 ghost rock from the Bank.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Choose any one Wanted dude in play. Until the end of the game any Player that aces the dude in a Shootout gets 5 ghost rock.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike. Only Terrors can move to the Abandoned Mine.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately before a Harrowed Dude is aced. Target the Dude, who is aced and automatically sent to Boot Hill - no Harrowed pull is made

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot Jane to move her to a location you own but do not control. Jane calls out one dude at that location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Job: Boot one of your Dudes to start a job that targets a Deed. If the job succeeds, pull: if the pull is black, the Deed is aced and all Dudes in your posse become Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target an unbooted Dude with Influence less than 2. Boot the Dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Boot Benny to reduce the cost of a gadget by two as it is being brought into play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Black Jack is always wanted

property.name: Text
property.value: GR: 19 Noon: Target and boot one of your Blackjacks Dudes to gain 2 ghost rock. The Dude becomes Wanted. This action can be used any number of times per turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: +1 ghost rock production for each Mad Scientist dude in play, to a maximum total production of +3.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately after players have revealed their Draw Hands. Discard yours and draw five new cards which becomes your new Draw Hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target any location. Until after nightfall, any dude in that location can as a Noon action start a Shootout with any other dude at that location. This is not "Calling Out". Any dude aced for losing a round of the Shootout goes home booted instead of being aced. Normal shootouts at this location resolve normally.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately before a Deed is aced. The Deed is not aced, but actions on the Deed cannot be used for the rest of this turn and the Deed produces no ghost rock until after Nightfall next turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Gadget Difficulty: 3. This dude cannot be aced as a result of a Draw hand rank in a Shootout unless his or her Draw Hand is beaten by at least two Ranks. Continue the Shootout for another round, if necessary.

property.name: Text
property.value: Dudes aced in a Shootout in the Morongo do not go to Boot Hill - they go to there Owner's discard pile, instead.

property.name: Text
property.value: If you control a saloon you may bring Cassidy into play for free at the saloon. Noon: Give a +1 Bullet bonus until the end of the turn to any other dude at the same deed as Cassidy. The Dude keeps the bonus even if he or she moves.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Select one dude in this Shootout, who may gain no benefit from any goods for this Shootout, and receives a -1 Bullet for this Shootout (minimum zero).

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Choose one strike in play. That strike is booted and produces no ghost rock; it may not unboot until a dude boots there as a Noon action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Charlie cannot be called out or move to a location you do not control. Noon: Boot Charlie when he is in a Saloon to dispense free drinks, resulting in a -1 Bullet penalty (minimum 0) until after Nightfall, for all other Dudes in the same Saloon as Charlie.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cheatin'! Reaction: Play when another Player reveals an illegal Draw Hand. His Draw Hand is reduced by three ranks from it's actual value (and is considered the worst possible hand of that Rank). Only one Cheatin' card can be played against a Player per draw.

property.name: Text
property.value: No calling out or jobs may take place during this turn. Once during this turn, each player may put into play for free any one goods card that they hold in their Play Hand. Ace this card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Strike you control. Boot one of your Dudes at the Strike to become the owner of the Strike until it leaves play. If the Strike leaves play, ownership immediately returns to its original owner.

property.name: Text
property.value: The Owner gains 1 ghost rock each time a player puts a strike into play. Controller Reaction: Boot and play 2 ghost rock to prevent the purchase of any strike deed. The deed is returned to the top of that players deck, and the ghost rock is returned to the players vault.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Wanted Dude in town. Boot one of your Dudes to call out the target Dude, at his or her location. If the Dude refuses, his or her Influence is permanently reduced to 0 and cannot be increased by any means for the rest of the game. If a Dude with 0 Influence refuses, the Dude is aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: Clell Miller gains a permanent +1 Bullet Bonus every time his posse aces another dude with a higher Bullet Rating in a Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cletus gains a +2 Bullet bonus for that shoot out when he calls someone out.

property.name: Text
property.value: GR: 17 You have one additional Control Point for every Gadget in play with Gadget Difficulty higher than four.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike. You can ace any one Strike with Production less than 3 when you bring this card into play. If you ace a Strike you control, reduce the ghost rock cost of this Strike by the Production of the one you aced.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout Pull: If the pull is red, Corky gets a +2 Bullet bonus for this Shootout. If it's black, she gets a -1 Bullet penalty (min zero) for this Shootout. Corky can do this action once per Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Target a Draw Dude in this shootout. The Dude is a Stud until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot one of your dudes who calls out any target booted dude in play. The target dude must accept and enter the shootout, which occurs at the target's location. If your dude has a lower Bullet rating than the target's printed Bullet rating, raise your Dude's Bullet rating to be equal to the target's. If your dude survives the Shootout, he or she becomes Wanted.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: Templeton gets a +2 Bullet bonus while anyone in an opposing posse in a shootout has a lower value.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. All of the Dispatch Office controller's Dudes at this location with Influence greater than 0 have a +1 Influence bonus while at this location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play this card when a dude is booting to join a posse. That dude does not boot and cannot join the posse for the rest of the shootout. This does not stop a dude from starting a posse.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Dude in the Town Square or at any Deed you control. Boot one of your Dudes at the same location to call out the target Dude. The target cannot refuse and no other Dudes can join the Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cheatin'! Reaction: Play when another player reveals an illegal Draw hand. That player's entire Draw hand is discarded and replaced by the top five cards of your deck. Your cards are discarded normally afterwards. Only one Cheatin' card can be played against a player per draw.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike. The Dude or Dudes in play with the lowest value are aced when this Strike is put into play from your Play hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Target one of your dudes in a Shootout. Gain no benefit for this dude in this round. Triple the Bullet rating for this dude in all consecutive rounds of the Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target and ace a Goods card in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Weapon. Gadge Difficulty: 5. Noon Job: If successful, boot this dude to ace the Launcher and the deed this dude is at. Pull: If the value is less than the dude's value he is returned home, otherwise he is aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: All strikes in play that produce less than 3 ghost rock per turn are destroyed.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each Player can pull for each one of his or her dudes that was aced last turn. If the pull is red, the dude returns to play at your home, unbooted. If the dude was Harrowed before, he or she remains Harrowed; otherwise, he or she returns to play as a normal, non-Harrowed dude. Ace this card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Eddie can never have a Bullet Rating higher than two. Shootout: Boot Eddie to look at the hand of an opponent who has dudes at this Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout Pull: Target a Weapon Gadget attached to Erik. If the pull is a ♣, ace Erik. Otherwise the Gadget gains a +3 Bullet bonus until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Eureka enters play attached to your gang. Whenever Eureka attaches to a Players Gang, that player draws two cards and adds them to his or her Play Hand. A Players maximum hand size is increased by 2 while Eureka is attached. Eureka leaves his player whenever a dude that player controls is aced and attaches to the next player on the left. If multiple dudes are aced simultaneously, Eureka! moves only once. Only one Eureka can be in play at a time.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Noon: Boot the Exchange Office to gain 1 ghost rock for every deed in play that produces more than 3 ghost rock.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a deed that you currently control but do not own. You maintain control of this deed until another player, as a Noon action, pays you ghost rock equal to the amount of Influence that you had at that location when you played this card. At that point, control of the deed is determined normally.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when Draw hands are compared in a shootout and your posse has won the round. The opposing posse takes two additional casualties.

property.name: Text
property.value: Father Juan cannot use the Blackjack home's ability to gain 2 ghost rock. Shootout: Boot Father Juan to remove him from this shootout and send him home.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot von Landingham to gain 2 ghost rock, brought in by airship from a secret mine in the Badlands.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike.

property.name: Text
property.value: You gain 2 ghost rock.

property.name: Text
property.value: The ghost rock cost of this card is double the target's Influence. Noon: Target one dude in play who becomes Wanted. That dude's controller may as a Noon action, boot a Law Dog he controls to Pull: if the pull is a red card, the dude is no longer Wanted and that Player can choose one of your dudes who become wanted instead.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Look at one of your opponents' Play Hands.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fu Leng's cost is reduced by 2 if you have Tao Cheng in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Choose a Dude and pull: If the pull is greater than the Dudes value, you gain control of the Dude until after Nightfall, but his or her Upkeep cost is tripled until after Nightfall. If you do not pay the Upkeep, the Dude is immediately returned to his or her original controller. Ace this card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Gadget Difficulty: 3.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play just after a dude performs an action and is at a deed you control. One of your dudes at that location may call out the acting dude who must accept the challenge. No other dudes may join this Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when one of your Dudes boots to join a posse. Your Dude does not boot to join the posse.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Pull: If the pull value is greater than the value of the target dude at one of your deeds, start a Shootout that may not be refused between that dude and one of your dudes at the same location. Any dudes adjacent to the deed may join either side of the Shootout. Dudes not actually in the targets location must boot to join in the posse.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Brothel. The owner gains 1 ghost rock each time a Dude is put into play from someone's Play hand. Ghost rock is not gained from token Dudes.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Get one ghost rock for each dude buried in Boot Hill.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. The Graveyard's owner gains 3 ghost rock each time a Dude is aced. Controller Reaction: When a Dude becomes Harrowed, boot the Graveyard to negate the effect. The Dude is not Harrowed.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target one Gadget in play. The Gadget is aced. Noon: Boot a Mad Scientist in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: No warrants or bounties can be issued for Gabriel. Gabriel cannot be wanted. Noon: Boot to ace any Wanted dude if Gabriel is in the same location or adjacent. Ace Gabriel after he "claims" a Wanted dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Play on any deed which has its' ghost rock production cut in half (round down). The deed gains the Badlands trait while haunted. The Haunting will end when a Blessed or Shaman dude at this deed is booted as a Noon action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately before a posse is formed for a job. Target one of your Dudes, who can join the posse regardless of the Dude's location and whether or not the Dude is booted. Movement restrictions still apply.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately after a Dude is aced. The Dude cannot be brought into play again through any means.

property.name: Text
property.value: Until after nightfall, dudes and posses may not move or ride farther than adjacent locations by any means.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: After Draw hands are revealed, you can discard a card from your Draw hand and redraw one card when Casparo is gambling (as a result of a card effect) or in a Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Pull: Choose a dude in any Boot Hill that you also hold in your Play hand. If the value of the pull is higher than the Dude's value, remove the dude in Boot Hill from the game and bring your Dude into play without cost. This Dude is now harrowed.

property.name: Text
property.value: When this deed is brought into play choose any one deed out of town that this deed is "adjacent to". Your posse gets a +1 Draw bonus when defending the Hideout, and always gets the first Shootout action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Town Founder. Lycanthrope. Shootout Pull: You can use this ability once per shootout. If the pull is red, put the Werewolf into play unbooted and under your control from your hand in place of Humphrey and put Humphrey into your play hand. Humphrey and the Werewolf are different Dudes for uniqueness purposes. All attached cards are discarded. If a Full Moon has occurred this turn, this pull is automatically red.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Remove one of your dudes from this Shootout. Your dude is sent home booted.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: The Town Sheriff. Coleman costs 5 less ghost rock to enter play from your Play hand or for upkeep if the Fear Level is higher than five. (*Coleman is also a member of The Agency.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Government. When a player aces a Wanted Dude, the player can put the Dude in Jail, collecting a bounty of half the Dude's ghost rock cost (round down). The Dude is not aced, but is out of play except for uniqueness. Any player can target the Jail with a Noon job - if successful, the player can send any number of jailed Dudes home booted. If the Jail leaves play, Dudes in it go home booted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Jessie will not call out a Law Dog.

property.name: Text
property.value: This card can only be used for Draw hands and pulls. Ace this card after it is used. The Joker is a wildcard: the player who draws it determines its suit and value. You may not have more than two Jokers in a deck. This card does not count against your deck limit.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately after Draw hands have been compared in a shootout. Your posse takes one less casualty.

property.name: Text
property.value: Sidekick. While Kenny is attached to a Dude in a shootout, he is a Dude in the posse with a 0 Draw Bullet rating. If Kenny is removed from the shootout, he becomes booted, remains attached to the same Dude, and is no longer a Dude. If Kenny is killed in a shootout, he is aced (not discarded).

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Saloon. Any Dude called out at the LAD Saloon has a +1 Bullet bonus for the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: You can discard as many of your cards as you like during Nightfall this turn.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: GR: 19 You get one Victory Point every time you put another player's Wanted dude into Jail, and every time you ace a Wanted dude who has more than one Influence.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot Lilith to gain 2 ghost rock if she is in a saloon or brothel.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: If Ted is in the same posse as a dude about to be aced, you may ace Ted instead.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Choose any one Wanted dude. Any Player may boot as many un-Wanted dudes they wish to join the mob. If the number of dudes in the lynch mob is greater than the combined Bullet Rating of the Wanted dude's gang at his location, then he is aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: Non-Unique. Gadgets created by Marcus have their ghost rock cost reduced by 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Horse. Gadget Difficulty: 4. Noon: Boot the Horse to move this dude to any other location. Reaction: Boot the Horse instead of this dude when joining the posse.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot Meredith to boot any non-terror dude at the same location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: When you put a strike in play, boot Mick and Pull: If it is a face card, the strike has +1 production. If it is a Joker, the strike has +2 production. These changes are permanent.

property.name: Text
property.value: The Union House's Controller never has his strike's production decreased when he is both the Owner and Controller of the Strike. The Production of the Union House is equal to the number of strikes in play.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Nash calls out one dude at this location. He may perform this action while booted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Boot Doc's and ace any non-Terror Dude you control to Harrow a dude who has just been aced. If you didn't control the dude before, you do now.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when an opposing Dude is aced in a shootout. Take a Goods from that Dude and attach it to one of your Dudes that was in the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Saloon. Anytime another player reveal an illegal Draw Hand, the Owner of the Old Moon Saloon gains 1 Ghost Rock.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Boot Oswald as a Gadget is producing an action to cancel the action. Shootout: Boot Oswald to reduce a weapon Gadget's bonus to zero. Only affects weapons in a Shootout Oswald is in.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Target a Stud Dude in this shootout. The Dude is a Draw until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when a Strike is aced to receive ghost rock equal to the amount that the strike would normally produce.

property.name: Text
property.value: Weapon. This Dude is a Stud while in a shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Noon: Boot the Pawnshop and ace a goods card you control to gain ghost rock equal to half of that card's ghost rock (round down).

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Noon: Boot the Pharmacy and pay two ghost rock to unboot a dude at an adjacent location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Reaction: Boot the Photographer Shop when a dude is brought into play to gain ghost rock equal to the dudes Influence.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike.

property.name: Text
property.value: Horse. Shootout: Boot the Pinto to remove this dude from this Shootout. Move this dude to any out of town deed you control (or home if you have no out of town deeds). This dude is booted. Pull: If the value is greater than your dude's value, the Pinto is aced at the end of the ride.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Noon: Boot to discard a card and draw a new one.

property.name: Text
property.value: Gadget Difficulty: 4. Reaction: Use the Elixir when this dude is aced to ace the Elixir instead. The Dude is not aced and goes home booted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play in the event of a tie (the same Hand Rank) in a Shootout to win the Shootout by one Rank.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Job: One of your dudes gathers a posse to raid your opponents Vault at his or her home. If the Raid is successful, Pull the top card from your opponents deck and take an amount of ghost rock equal to half (round up) from the target Player. All dudes in your posse are wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Weapon. Gadget Difficulty: 6 This Gadget has no ghost rock cost if being attached to Erik Zarkov.

property.name: Text
property.value: Horse. Reaction: Boot the Roan instead of this Dude when riding to a new location. You cannot move a booted Dude in this fashion.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot Holmes to retrieve any one Gadget from Boot Hill and shuffle it into your deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike.

property.name: Text
property.value: Horse. Gadget: 6. Shootout: Move this Dude to the location of the shootout. The Dude joins your posse. Shootout: Boot the Rocket Pack to leave this shootout and move home. Noon: Boot the Rocket Pack to move this Dude to a different location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cheatin'! Reaction: Play when another Player reveals an illegal Draw Hand. Target any one dude controlled by that player. Pull: If the value is equal to or higher than the dude's value, the dude is discarded along with any goods he controls. Only one Cheatin'! Card can be played against a player per draw.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Reaction: Boot to reduce by 2 the cost of any goods cards you are putting into play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Look at a random card in another Players Play Hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when one of your dudes just Aced someone else's Dude during a shootout or with an action. Your dude permanently gains Influence equal to one half of the aced dude's Influence (round down).

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Government. Schoolhouse may not enter play if the fear level is above 3.

property.name: Text
property.value: All of your Gadgets cost 1 less ghost rock to bring into play while you control the Scrapyard.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when one of your Dudes is moving to a new location (not as part of a posse). This move does not boot your Dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately after a pull is revealed. The pull is discarded and the player making the pull redraws.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Holy Ground. Terrors cannot move to St. Martin's Chapel or call out a Dude in it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot the Still and this dude to boot any other dude in play with a lower value than your dude. Noon Pull: Boot the Still. This dude permanently changes his value into the value of the pull. If the pull was an ace, the Still and this dude are aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Target a Dude in the opposing posse. The Dude has a -2 Bullet penalty (minimum 0) until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Pull: If the pull is a ♣, ace this Dude. Otherwise, boot this Dude and attach the Dynamite to this Deed. Any Dude can start a Noon job that targets the Dynamite - if the job succeeds, the Dynamite is aced. If the Dynamite is still attached to the Deed after Nightfall, ace the Deed and discard the Dynamite.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Law Dogs

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: T.C. gets a +2 Bullet bonus in a Shootout if none of the opponents are carrying a weapon.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Other players cannot take ghost rock from the controller of the 1st Bank. If control of the 1st Bank changes, the new controller takes half of the old controllers ghost rock (round down). All Dudes have a -1 Influence penalty (min zero) while at the 1st Bank.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Any non-Gadget Horse you put into play has its ghost rock cost reduced by 3.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Government. Only a Law Dog can move to The Courthouse. Controller Noon: Target a Wanted Dude. Boot The Courthouse to make the Dude un-Wanted. Controller Noon: Target a Dude in Jail. Boot The Courthouse to ace the Dude - card effects cannot prevent the Dude from being aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: If the Fear Level is less than 4, all Terrors are booted and cannot unboot or perform actions this turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Controller Noon: Boot The Slaughterhouse to remove any Dude in Boot Hill from play. The Dude cannot be brought into play by any player for the rest of this game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Any Dudes at this location are considered adjacent to all Deeds in town but cannot be called out without a card effect.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. The Undertaker's controller gains 1 ghost rock every time a Dude is aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. The Branch Office counts as 1 Influence toward the controller's total. Controller Reaction: When an un-Wanted Dude becomes Wanted, boot the Branch Office to gain 2 ghost rock.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Reaction: Boot Town Hall and one or more of your dudes to prevent a deed from entering play. Your dudes must have more total Influence than the ghost rock cost of the deed to perform this action. The deed is aced but no ghost rock is spent.

property.name: Text
property.value: Abomination. For each dude that is aced at the same location, she gains +1 Bullet until after nightfall.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Boot Victor to join any Shootout immediately after Draw Hands are shown, if anyone in your gang are in the Shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target an un-Wanted Dude. Boot one or more of your Dudes with a combined Influence greater than the Influence of the target. The target Dude becomes Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Controller Noon: Boot the Wishing Well and spend 1 ghost rock. Pull: 2-5, get nothing; 6-8 get one ghost rock; 9-J get 2 ghost rock; Q-K get 3 ghost rock; A, get 4 ghost rock; Joker, lose 2 ghost rock (if possible).

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when a dude refuses when being called out. The dude is -1 Influence and -1 Bullet (Minimum zero) permanently.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target one of your dudes in the Town Square. Each opposing Player may send one of their dudes for a Shootout with your dude, or else must give you one ghost rock. Begin with the player on your left and go clockwise once around the table. If your dude is aced by a challenger the remaining players do not have to pay you. No other dudes may join these Shootouts.
